title: The design and long-term use of a personal electronic notebook: a reflective analysis
proctitle: CHI '96: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

authors.name: Thomas Erickson
authors.institution: Advanced Technology, Apple Computer, Inc., 1 Infinite Loop, 301-4UE, Cupertino CA

references.text: 1. Assimacopoulos, A., Revillard, C., Herrmann, F., Borst, F., Paschoud, N. and Scherrer, J. R. An Electronic Notebook for Problem Oriented Patient Progress Notes: Testing a Concept.
2. Conklin, J. and Begeman, M. L. gIBIS: A Hypertext Tool for Exploratory Policy Discussion.
3. Dejan, D. and Dejan, S. B.
4. Fowler, J., Baker, D. G., Dargahi, R., Kouramajian, V., Gilson, H., Long, K. B., Petermann, C., and Gorry, A. G. Experience with the Virtual Notebook System: Abstraction in Hypertext.
5. Halasz, F., Moran, T. P., and Trigg, R. H. NoteCards in a Nutshell.
8. Monty, M. L. and Moran, T. P. A Longitudinal Study of Authoring Using NoteCards.
9. Neuwirth, C., Kaufer, D., Chimera, R., and Gillespie, T. The Notes Program: A Hypertext Application for Writing from Source Texts: Experiences and Writing.
10. Schnase, J. L. and Leggett, J. J. Computational Hypertext in Biological Modeling Applications.
11. Shipman, F. M., Chaney, R. J., and Gorry, G. A., Distributed Hypertext for Collaborative Research: The Virtual Notebook System.
12. Trigg, R. H. and Irish, P. M. Hypertext Habitats: Experiences of Writers in NoteCards:
13. Twidale, M., Rodden, T., and Sommerville, I. The Designers' Notepad: Supporting and Understanding Cooperative Design.
